message.content:
cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.SI, cs.SY, cs.HC 

This paper is likely to belong to the Information Retrieval (cs.IR) sub-category as it proposes a recommendation method to improve collaborative filtering, which is a common technique used in information retrieval systems. It could also belong to the Machine Learning (cs.LG) sub-category as the proposed method involves using Pearson Correlation Similarity (PCC) and involves evaluating its effectiveness through experimental evaluation. Additionally, it could belong to the Social and Information Networks (cs.SI) sub-category as collaborative filtering is often used in social networks to provide personalized recommendations. The Systems and Control (cs.SY) sub-category is also a possibility as the proposed method aims to improve the overall user experience in online domains that use collaborative recommender systems. Finally, the Human-Computer Interaction (cs.HC) sub-category is another possibility as the proposed method aims to assist users in decision making by providing recommendations of better quality, which is a common goal in HCI research.
